article_title: Survey of 20,000 Physicians Reports Morale Still Low, But Slightly Improving

article_metadata.description: A new survey of 20,000 physicians, commissioned by The Physicians Foundation, reports that 56 percent of physicians describe their morale as negative. However, optimism has increased over 12 percentage points – from 32 to 44 percent optimistic – since 2012.
article_metadata.author: Walker Ray, MD and Tim Norbeck

og.description: A new survey of 20,000 physicians, commissioned by The Physicians Foundation, reports that 56 percent of physicians describe their morale as negative. However, optimism has increased over 12 percentage points – from 32 to 44 percent optimistic – since 2012.
